data.title: Raymond Felton – Athletes of Valor
data.text:
Degree Programs:

Mechanic And Repair Technologies/Technicians.

Homeland Security, Law Enforcement, Firefighting And Related Protective Services.

States:

No preference

Accolades: Varsity Letter in 2013-14 for Wrestling Football & Band2x All star for the RVA TomahawksCaptain for the RVA Tomahawks 2018Played with the Charlottesville Silverbacks & Northern Neck Rivermen being a productive member on and off the field. Invited to multiple team USA football events with nfl, cfl, college and arena scouts where I performed exceptionally well. Play DE, DT, MLB.I’m a very coachable player, and even though my military background is brief I excelled in multiple areas of it and my teammates and coaches always point out my discipline and attacking of tasks before anything else. I didn’t get that into football until high school but I didn’t pick up the weight for the position I wanted to play until I joined the military. My goal has always been to be an asset to my team in the most productive way on and off the field. Actively involved in the community in multiple facets including feeding the homeless and building homes also. Apart of the car organization “Changin Lanez” and we promote education, help kids stay off the streets, unity amongst other groups and prevent destruction of the communities that we ride around. Post military life I am police dispatch for the City of Richmond, also work on Dogwood Trace Golf Course in Petersburg VA.

Name: Hopewell High School

Graduation Date June 2014

Hometown: Petersburg, VA
